verses.roman:
tataḥ kāla upāvṛtte
kukṣiṁ nirbhidya dakṣiṇam
yuvanāśvasya tanayaś
cakravartī jajāna ha

synonyms: tataḥ—thereafter; kāle—time; upāvṛtte—being mature; kukṣim—the lower part of the abdomen; nirbhidya—piercing; dakṣiṇam—the right side; yuvanāśvasya—of King Yuvanāśva; tanayaḥ—a son; cakravartī—with all the good symptoms of a king; jajāna—generated; ha—in the past.
translation: Thereafter, in due course of time, a son with all the good symptoms of a powerful king came forth from the lower right side of King Yuvanāśva's abdomen.
